children.subject:
This dependent on a couple of things. 

1) Whether this is true for lecture, lab, and discussion section waitlists

2) Whether we're still holding 30% of the class for TA hiring. We don't release all seats until this is done (regardless of adjustment period).

I'm a non-CS/EECS major. Currently I'm on the waitlist for an upper div cs course and my position is lower than the available seats. When the adjustment period begins, if my waitlist position is still lower than the available seats, will I be enrolled in the course?
I've been hearing this question a lot recently so I thought I'd bump this post. What Lily said 5 months ago still holds true for those enrolling in F17 classes.

history.content:
As with telebears, classes are technically open or have "available seats," but many of the CS classes have filled to our usual 70% of the projected enrollment capacity until we are sure that we have enough teaching resources to fill the class. 

If you weren't able to waitlist, please make sure the waitlist box is checked as depicted in @1735.

Please read more about our enrollment policies here. also see @2309

If you are on the waitlist and your waitlist position is higher than the number of available seats, please do plan for a backup course.

 

  • But I'm a graduating senior, don't I have priority?
    • After phase 2 ends/during adjustment period, neither major status nor class standing will impact enrollment.
  • But I need this CS upper div to graduate! 
    • Technically, no because no specific CS upper div is required for graduation.

The course is open, and I can't even get on the waitlist, and am getting an error. 

  • The section you selected probably has a  waitlist that is full. The green circles indicate if there are available seats in the course, and does not provide you with any information about the waitlist. While there are many places for you to get information about the waitlist & enrollment numbers, we've found the easiest place to do is classes.berkeley.edu. Let's use CS 170 as an example. Section 105 would give you a green circle because there are 2 open seats. However the waitlist is full, so you would get an error. You can also find this information in Cal Central if you click on the hyperlink for that section, see picture below

history.subject: I'm declared EECS/CS, Cal Central says the CS upper div is open, but I'm waitlisted, why?

history.content:
Now that phase 2 has begun, we're getting a lot of these questions.

As with telebears, classes are technically open or have "available seats," but many of the CS classes have filled to our usual 70% of the projected enrollment capacity until we are sure that we have enough teaching resources to fill the class. 

If you weren't able to waitlist, please make sure the waitlist box is checked as depicted in @1735.

Please read more about our enrollment policies here.

If you are on the waitlist and your waitlist position is higher than the number of available seats, please do plan for a back up course.

 

  • But I'm a graduating senior, don't I have priority?
    • Seniors have priority over non-majors on the waitlist. After phase 2 ends/during adjustment period, neither major status nor class standing will impact enrollment.
  • But I need this CS upper div to graduate! 
    • Technically, no because no specific CS upper div is required for graduation.

 

also see @1656
